intro: Amsinckia toussaintii, commonly known as the desert sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its yellow, daisy-like flowers and hairy, lobed leaves adapted to arid environments. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in desert and rocky habitats. Amsinckia toussaintii is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
